page.title: 03Burbage Common And Woods
page.content: Occupying some{74.4 hectares}of land Burbage Common and woods are a major feature of the local landscape. The site lies between two trunk roads, the A47 and the A5070. Access to the Common is by three car parks on the A47 together with a number of footpaths. The common has been designated a site of{special {scientific interest.} The common is home to 240 species of flowering plant, 36 types of breeding birds and countless other flora and fauna. The woodlands are not "ancient", dating back to 1600 AD. Burbage Common attracts many visitors each year and the pressure this causes on the environment has led to the appointment of a Countryside Ranger to oversee the management of the area.
